keyword: how many calories in crab legs
title: How Many Calories Are in Crab Legs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in crab legs per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Crab Legs?
assumptions: Cooked Alaskan king crab legs, meat only (shell removed), steamed, no added butter or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by crab type (king, snow, Dungeness), size, cooking method, and added ingredients like butter. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked crab legs provides about 90 kcal and 18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Dipped in 1 tbsp melted butter per 100 g
Snow crab instead of king crab per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g crab legs?
faqs.a: Approximately 90 kcal for cooked king crab legs, meat only.

faqs.q: Are crab legs high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 18 g protein per 100 g, with low fat and carbs.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in crab legs?
faqs.a: Around 500 mg per 100 g, which can vary with preparation.
Yes, roughly 70 mg per 100 g; mostly from natural shellfish content.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in crab legs?
faqs.a: Steaming or boiling keeps calories low; frying or butter adds significantly more.
